intro: Chayamaritia smitinandii, commonly known as the Smitinandii chayamaritia, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
